jobText: TXT/50690060.txt	§Director of Football§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Director of Football§§Advertiser: §Papamoa FC§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§Papamoa FC - Expression of Interest - Director of Football§ §Papamoa FC are one of the largest clubs in the WaiBop region with our playing numbers increasing year on year. We are a club which operates juniors through to seniors. We expect to be the largest club by participants in the region within the next few years.§ §We are the reigning WaiBop Premiership Champions having achived back to back titles in 2019 and 2020. We aspire to entering NRFL and are well on our way to achieving this.§ §We have great fields, what we believe to be the best fields in the city and in what we believe to be the best location in the country.§ §As such we are seeking a suitably Qualified Director of Football to lead the club forward in our continuing quest for improvement.§ §The applicant must hold a minimum of an OFC/NZF C Licence with a view to achieving a B Licence in 2021 or hold an international B Licence equivalent. § §We are happy to accept applications from someone who can provide a B Licence or better to support their application.§ §The applicant must also hold or intend to be fully NZF J3 qualified by March 2021.§ §We are open to how this looks in terms of delivery and may consider someone delivering in a lesser or greater capacity.§ §This is a contract/contractor role for the 2021 season. At the time of applying, candidates are invited to indicate their expected income expectations and preference of delivery capacity.§ §The DOF at a minimum shall have overall responsibility for§ § §Developing and delivering training programmes at all levels for all members throughout the club with a key focus on our Junior and Youth framework. This is Including but not limited to annual reaccreditation of NZF programmes.§ §Delivering Coach development workshops and upskilling all coaches within Papamoa FC.§ §Managing and administering the Clubs Trials management programme.§ §Delivering PFC annual tournaments (boys and girls).§ §Delivering Holiday Programmes.§ §Delivering in schools.§ § § §Please send your CV and covering letter by email to president@papamoafootballclub.co.nz§ § § §Applications close on Sunday the 11th of October however should a suitable applicant apply we will be in contact sooner.§ § § §All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in an administration role?§§§

jobTitle: Group Fitness Instructor Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50691235.txt	§Group Fitness Instructor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Fitness Instructor§§Advertiser: §True Womans Fitness§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Salary§§$30 - $39.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§Who are we? §True Womans Fitness is the largest women's only gym in NZ  currently located in Manukau with around 20 group fitness staff. §We are looking at expansion to §Hamilton§ starting with offering a women's only Group Fitness timetable including Les Mills to the women of the Waikato. §It will begin with a 4 week trial from a school hall in Puketaha (5 minutes from Rototuna) with the potential to grow the timetable and become permanent if class numbers grow and show viability. §Who do we need ?§We are looking for female Les Mills instructors who are qualified or training to become qualified in BodyCombat, BodyBalance or Grit. §Alternatively experienced group fitness instructors who can deliver a 30 minute HIIT class with no equipment (ie: similar to a Grit class), Yoga, pilates or similar. §To begin with, we are wanting to hold classes at 6am, 9.15am and 6.30pm  between Monday and Friday. §Your responsibilities ?§Will be to put on a kick ass class to a group of women, be high energy, caring, fun and enthusiastic. §You will also need to engage with clients as the arrive at and leave class and potentially to lock up and unlock the building. §What will you get ? §Between $30-40 per class depending on class length and experience. §You will also get to be part of launching the True brand in a new city and be part of the awesome team at True. §Check us out on instagram at @truewomanfitness §Send CV outlining experience and availability to §andrea@truewoman.co.nz§ §§§§

jobTitle: Amberley Pool Lifeguards 2020/21 season Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50695692.txt	§Amberley Pool Lifeguards 2020/21 season§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Amberley Pool Lifeguards 2020/21 season§§Advertiser: §Hurunui District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §North Canterbury§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§The Hurunui District Council are looking for competent, 'pool smart' people able to work a variety of hours on a fixed-term part-time basis including weekends, over the 2020/2021 summer season.§ §The Amberley pool is open from mid-November to mid-March for school use and public sessions. Training and preparation of the pool will start in early November.§ §Ideally, you will have lifeguard experience but full training will be provided. Duties of lifeguards include ensuring guest safety, enforcing rules, responding to emergencies and providing medical care as trained. All staff perform cleaning duties to maintain a safe and clean facility.§ §You will need to have a strong commitment to health and safety standards and to ensure high standards of customer service.§ §If selected for an interview for a lifeguard position, you will be required to complete a swim competency test. This involves:§ § §Swim 200m freestyle in under 6 minutes (in togs, goggles are permitted)§ §Swim 50m breaststroke (in lifeguard uniform)§ §Swim 25m sidestroke (in lifeguard uniform)§ §Retrieve and object from the bottom of the pool (min 1.2 m - max 3m in lifeguard uniform)§ §Tread water for 5 minutes (in lifeguard uniform)§ §If you have a passion for swimming, a strong customer service ethic, relate well to adults and children, reliable, and have a positive, cheerful, outgoing personality, and are a team player then we would love to hear from you.§ §Preference may be given to applicants who are already qualified and those who are available for the full season.§ §If you are a swim teacher this could also be incorporated into the role. We will also take expressions of interest for swim teachers.§ §For additional information and position description email charlie.hutt@hurunui.govt.nz or phone 027 808 9113.§ § § §To apply for this job go to: hdcjobs.co.nz/Vacancies & enter ref code: 5237456. § §Applications close 25 October 2020§§§§

jobTitle: Rugby 1st XV Coach/Co-Coach Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50696402.txt	§Rugby 1st XV Coach/Co-Coach§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Rugby 1st XV Coach/Co-Coach§§Advertiser: §King's High School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§We want to appoint an effective head coach and/or co-coach to lead our 1st XV Rugby team at King’s High School for the 2021 season.§  §Commencing January 2021§  §King's High School - First XV Coach/Co-Coach§  §Purpose§ §  §To develop our 1st XV players and coaching team to perform highly.  To be responsible for planning and delivering our 1st XV programme.§  §Background§  §King’s High School rugby is recognised as being at the forefront of secondary school rugby in Otago and Southland; demonstrating outstanding participation, coaching, facilities, results and pathways to professional careers.§  §Since the school’s inception in 1936, King’s has produced 13 All Blacks, 15 Internationals, 10 Super Rugby players and over 70 First Class Representatives.  Rugby continues to be the most popular sport at King’s with over 200 players participating across 8 teams each week.  Rugby adds much to the character and competitiveness of the boys and school.§  §Recent 1st XV success has included 3 finals and 1 championship in the Otago Premier Schools competition, 3 New Zealand Barbarian Schools representatives, and 9 Highlanders Schools representatives. The 2019 Otago U16 team also contained 16 players from King’s.§  §We are now looking for our next coach to add to the quality of our premier rugby team and proud record of rugby excellence at King’s.§ §Personal Qualities/Skills§  §Applicants should have:§ § §A love of rugby§ §Proven ability to motivate aspiring rugby players and to coach them well§ §Experience in dynamic and successful leadership and management in or out of sport§ §Proven ability to set tactics and lead strategic direction successfully§ §Understanding of contemporary rugby performance § §Commitment to the highest sporting and personal standards in coach and player conduct, and to upholding our positive 1st XV culture and King’s Lions’ Sport values § §Commitment to foster wider King’s High School development through sport§ §Exceptional communication and relationship skills§ §Experience in reviewing sporting performance and use of analysis software§ §Proven record of being well organised and coping while under pressure§ §A sense of humour and other desirable, and sometimes necessary, personal attributes§ §The appointed person will report to the King’s Director of Rugby. This position will be reviewed on an annual basis. §  §Applications are to be made online through Seek, and should include; a cover letter outlining:§ § §Why you are well suited to this position§ §What you would do with the position, if appointed§ §Curriculum Vitae to summarise your rugby experience§ §Contact information for three referees§ §For more information about King’s High School, please see our website  https://www.kingshigh.school.nz§  §Contact our Director of Rugby, Glenn Dickson, if you have any questions regarding this role or the selection process: Directorofsport@kingshigh.school.nz§  §(Note: This position may potentially be combined with a Teaching post at King’s High School in 2021.   If also seeking a teaching job please provide your teaching Curriculum Vitae as well).§  §Deadline for applications: 5pm 30 October 2020§  §We look forward to hearing from you.§  §Glenn Dickson§Director of Sport§Director of Rugby§King’s High School§§§§

As well as the ability to accommodate members restrictions with exercises and offer suitable regressions.§ §Ensure the studio is kept clean and tidy.§ §A willingness to work flexible hours.§ §Skills & Experience:§ § §Experience in delivering group fitness sessions.§ §Excellent verbal skills- in particular, the ability to command a large group efficiently and effectively.§ §Willingness to work flexible hours, in particular, early mornings and evenings.§ §Ability to motivate members.§ §Enthusiastic and supportive attitude towards members.§ §Ability to develop and nurture strong relationships with members.§ §Self-motivated and goal orientated.§ §Passionate, enthusiastic and genuinely motivated to improve the lives of others.§ §Excellent attention to detail, especially when it comes to movement patterns.§ §Culture & Benefits:§ § §Opportunity for growth as we grow our business.§ §Ongoing mentoring opportunities.§ §Commitment to work-life balance § §Training provided on F45 product and technology.§ §Small, motivated team to work in.§ §Great support network within the F45 Group.§ §Free F45 Marshland Membership to attend classes.§ §Qualifications/Requirements:§ § §Certificate 4 in Fitness (Diploma or degree desirable).§ §Current First Aid and CPR.§ §A willingness to continue learning and upskilling.§  § §If you want to join our team please send your CV to jduff@f45training.co.nz§ §While we appreciate everyone who takes the time to apply, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50709627.txt	§Lead Lifeguard, Birkenhead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Lifeguard, Birkenhead§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Coaching & Instruction§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Lead Lifeguard, Birkenhead §      §        §          §Help make a positive contribution to your community at our popular pool facilities§          §Vital role within a supportive and safety-focussed team§          §Permanent and Secondment/Fixed-term opportunity until 2 April 2021§        §        § §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        § §        §Our pool and leisure facilities are more popular than ever, and as Lead Lifeguard for Birkenhead Pool and Leisure Centre you will play a key part in ensuring that all customers not only have a fantastic experience but a safe one. Your main responsibilities will include:§        § §        §          §Providing guidance on and supporting the delivery of aquatics based programmes;§          §General lifeguarding duties to ensures customers are safe and looked after; and§          §Supporting the Team Leader with day to day operations at the Centre.§        §        § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        § §        §It goes without saying that you’ll have a passion for aquatics, and you’ll enjoy sharing your knowledge and experience with customers and colleagues to improve water safety. You will be an excellent communicator, and committed to delivering exceptional aquatic programmes and providing a high level of customer satisfaction.  Joining an energetic and passionate team, you’ll be a keen team player with a flexible approach, and be able to take initiative to help drive a positive safety culture.§        § §        §You’ll need to hold a current First Aid Certificate as well as a Pool Lifeguard Practising Certificate. As the centre operates 7 days a week, reliability and commitment to working early, late and weekend shifts are crucial.§        § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        § §        §You’ll have access to a range of fantastic Auckland Council benefits, including an annual zoo pass and a range of partnership discounts. And as you will be a Leisure Centre employee, you will enjoy free use of the facilities. To find out more about Birkenhead Pool and Leisure, please visit our §website§.§        § §        §We have a full-time permanent and a secondment/fixed-term opportunity until 2 April 2021. jobText: TXT/50745994.txt	§Drug Free Sport NZ Educator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Drug Free Sport NZ Educator§§Advertiser: §Drug Free Sport NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$100 per workshop§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§About the business§ § §Drug Free Sport New Zealand (DFSNZ) is New Zealand's national anti-doping organisation committed to protecting and promoting a culture of clean, drug free sport.  In conjunction with a comprehensive Testing and Investigations programme, DFSNZ is responsible for education and promotion of clean sport.  § § §About the role§ § §We have an exciting opportunity in Auckland for a new Educator to join the DFSNZ education team.  As an external contractor to DFSNZ, you will facilitate workshops and webinars to elite-level, national and development athletes and their support personnel.  You will also facilitate values-based workshops in secondary schools.  You will facilitate content provided by DFSNZ and work on as-required basis.  On occasion, you may also be asked to facilitate Outreach Programmes at various sports events. It will be preferred if the successful candidate can occasionally travel overnight to deliver workshops regionally.§ §As a contractor, you will be paid per workshop.  On average, you will deliver 25 workshops per year.  § § §Benefits and perks§ § §This role provides the opportunity to educate athletes and support personnel and gain a unique insight into various sporting environments. § §As a contractor, this role provides the freedom to incorporate this work around other commitments you may have.  § § §Skills and experience§ § §We are seeking a confident, personable individual who is passionate about clean sport.  The ideal candidate will be a current or former athlete who has experience in delivering workshops.   You will need to have confidence to present to large audiences and the ability to engage with a wide range of athletes across a variety of settings.  You must have flexibility to be We have plans in place to take the strong foundations of our past and build an unbeatable platform for the future. §That is where you come in.   As Club Operations & Development Manager, this is the job you have been waiting for.§Crazy about the game, you know what it takes and will be responsible for ensuring and assisting the Club Board to deliver the strategic objectives of the club and facilitate the day to day running of the club. Working with Auckland Rugby and the Club, the Club Operations Manager is responsible for generating new revenue opportunities through a robust financial management strategy. Using the availability of grant and trust funding to ensure the club is financially sustainable. Additionally, working to creating new and exciting sponsorship opportunities to further assist the club financially.§You will be responsible for the implementation of the rugby participation growth strategy for the Club. Focused on attracting, retaining, and developing players, coaches, managers, and volunteers and working with the local schools to create a positive relationship between the club and these connected communities. This will be achieved through collaborating with Auckland Rugby, Club members and the local school networks to promoting benefits to rugby participation.§You're like Richie - hardworking, humble, a reluctant hero, and the face of the team without hogging the limelight. You are known as a good sport, the guy that sets the standard, and the one who'll kick you into shape if you let the team down.§You take pride in your No 8 wire mentality and you run a professional ship. The sides at Eden Rugby Club reflect a strong multi-cultural grouping of Europeans, Maoris, Polynesians, and Asians all proud to be associated with the club. Although this generation of players may support the 'blue and white' hoops of Auckland, the 'sky blue' of the Blues and the 'almighty black' of the All Blacks, they all proudly wear the gold and black hoops of the Eden Rugby Club. Take the plunge and become a Summer Pool Lifeguard! Full training and support provided in a large organisation with options for career development and progression.§ § § §This role is for the summer period only, starting mid-November or December 2020 until the end of March 2021.  Hours of work will vary week to week depending on the roster.  We are open 7 days from 5.30am to 9.30pm Monday to Friday and 7am to 7pm in the weekend.  §Applicants MUST be available to work over the Christmas and New Year period.§ § § §We are looking for lifeguards to work at our centres based in Onehunga and Panmure.  § § § §YMCA IS RECRUITING NOW!§ §A typical day in the life of our Lifeguards will include supervising pool users ensuring a safe and fun environment for all and rotating around different stations and pools – all while interacting and building relationships with our customers.§ § § §What will you need?§ § §Confidence in swimming – there will be a swim test involved§ §Enthusiasm and responsibility§ §Ability to work effectively across all cultures and ages§ §Strong communication and high work standards§ §Great work ethics and a team player attitude§ §Effective problem solving and ability to think and act fast§ §Experience in a customer service role or similar preferable  § § § §What the YMCA offers: § § §Full training – you will gain a PLPC (Pool Lifeguard Practising Certificate)§ §Ongoing training and professional development provided§ §Opportunity to build your career within the YMCA§ §Full gym membership across multiple locations§ § § §ABOUT THE YMCA§ §You probably know the song, but did you also know that YMCA North employs around 800 employees across Auckland, Hamilton, Tauranga and Rotorua? Our operations include facility management, health and fitness, early childhood education, before and after school care, holiday programmes, accommodation, outdoor camps, recreation, aquatic, fundraising and youth programmes. As a not for profit, for over 150 years YMCA has been about families. Join us and know that you’re contributing to building strong kids, families and communities now and for many years to come.§ § § §YMCA is able to offer great opportunities for personal development and career advancement. We provide real career pathways and job opportunities in a fun, community-focused environment.  We are proud to have a great mix of people of all ages and cultures within our teams who love their work and all contribute to our diverse company culture. We live by our values of Caring, Honesty, Respect and Responsibility.§ § § §SAFEGUARDING§ §YMCA North is committed to Child Protection and the safeguarding of children and young people in our care and it is our expectation that all staff will operate in a way that reflects this intent. Staff will be required to attend Safeguarding workshops, trainings and online modules to comply with YMCA North Safeguarding Policy.§ § § §The successful applicant will need to return a satisfactory Police Record Check before commencement of Employment.§ § § §All applicants must currently hold the right to work in New Zealand.§ § § §TO APPLY§ §If this sounds like you and you enjoy working in a dynamic team environment, please apply online by using the Apply Now button to submit your cover letter and CV.  Please state on your cover letter if you would prefer to work at Panmure or Onehunga or across both.§ § § §Alternatively applications for Panmure can be sent to §tepuea.li@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ and application for Onehunga can be sent to §roberto.matimtim@ymcaauckland.org.nz§ § § §We will be assessing applications as they are received. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current Royal Life Saving Pool Lifeguard certificate?§Are you available to work public holidays?§Do you have any leave planned in the next 6 months?§Which of the following days and times are you available to work?§§§

jobText: TXT/50741390.txt	§Seasonal  Fixed Term Lifeguards §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Seasonal  Fixed Term Lifeguards §§Advertiser: §Horowhenua District Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§Pool Lifeguard – Fixed Term. §Join our amazing Team of Lifeguards!§Aquatics Horowhenua opened its doors in 1990 and since then it has been continuously growing and expanding. We offer a variety of activities such as learn to swim, aquacise, fitness training, swim and water sports clubs as well as recreational water fun including inflatables and the hydro slide. It’s easy to understand why our facilities are so popular!§About us.§We are located at the heart of the Horowhenua District, featuring a stunning natural environment on the lower west coast of the North Island, where the mountains meet the sea. Kilometres of unspoilt beaches, forest walks and a hinterland that is rich in both Maori and European history. Horowhenua is blessed with superb natural assets, treasured historical heritage and a thriving cultural life, all within easy reach of New Zealand's capital city Wellington, which is just over an hour drive to the south.§Horowhenua can offer all essential services and sophisticated facilities and at the same time also provides a wealth of quintessential New Zealand experiences from the simple pleasures of a walk along a pristine beach to experiencing life in classic, Kiwi small towns. With about 30,000 residents living between the Tararua Ranges and the Tasman Sea, Horowhenua is the perfect place to live, work and play.§About the role§.§We have a number of fixed-term roles available across Levin, Shannon and Foxton with varying hours. You would join a dynamic team of professionals who deliver excellent public service to our community through ensuring enjoyment and active supervision by identifying risks, hazards, and the prevention of accidents. You would interact with a variety of people from different ages and backgrounds which will enrich your skills and cultural experience.§We are open 7 days a week, including public holidays, and our roster offers shifts between the hours of 5:30am and 9:30pm, at our local centres in Levin, Foxton, and Shannon.§About you.§Our ideal candidates will share a passion for service delivery and customer satisfaction, with a strong positive attitude. As one of the requirements to become a Lifeguard, applicants would need to be confident in the water and be able to swim 200 metres in under 6 minutes.§If this sounds like the ideal place and role for you, we would like to hear from you. For any questions or additional information, please contact us on §06 368 0070§.§Shortlisted applicants will be invited for a swim test and job suitability assessment prior to an interview. Preferred applicants will need to undergo the usual pre-employment checks including drug and criminal history checks. Successful applicants will be required to attend a full week of training.§Applications close: 30th October 2020 at 5pm. §For a copy of the Job Description visit §JD---Aquatics-Poolside-Lifeguard---April-2020-CURRENT.pdf§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50756853.txt	§Summer Staff§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Summer Staff§§Advertiser: §Community Leisure Management§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Sport & Recreation§, §Other§§§§§§About§ §The Lido Aquatic Centre is seeking a part time Customer Service, lifeguards and Swim Instructors to join their team.  The Lido Aquatic Centre includes both indoor and outdoor pools, hydroslides, and is also home to New Zealand’s largest and fastest growing swim school; SwimMagic. § §Customer Service Positions§ §The position includes working on our front desk dealing with enquiries, facility bookings, cash handling and other administration tasks.  Previous customer service, sales and administration experience is essential.  You need to enjoy working with a team, be friendly, enthusiastic, honest and reliable.  You must be able to work unsupervised, be organised, computer savvy and have a passion for health and fitness and sport and recreation.§ §Lifeguard § §Ideally you will hold relevant lifeguarding qualifications however on-site training can be provided for those wanting to enter this exciting industry. Experience working in an aquatic environment and the ability to follow systems and procedures would be advantageous. You need to enjoy working with a team, be friendly, enthusiastic, honest and reliable. You must be able to work unsupervised, be organised, computer savvy and have a passion for health and fitness and sport and recreation.§ §Swim Instructors§ §You must have a passion for swimming and be comfortable working with children of all ages and all abilities. Experience and relevant swim teaching qualifications are preferred however training and support can be offered to the right candidates. You need to enjoy working within a team in a professional manner and within a structured system. You will be dependable, honest, organised and have excellent communication skills.§ §Hours§ §The roles are part time and are based around the opening hours of the facility, and therefore the role may require you to work early morning, late shifts and weekend work.  Flexibility is key to ensure that the facilities are being run to highest possible standard.§ §Benefits § §Ongoing training and development and free use of facilities available.§ §Relevant qualifications in this area would be advantageous, however training can be provided for the role. § §How to apply§ §If you are a team player and enjoy an exciting work environment please apply in writing with a current CV and a covering letter §indicating which role you are applying for§ to Alisha Patel on §alp@clmnz.co.nz§ §Application period closes Sunday 25th October 2020§§§§
